list.title: AttributeFilter
list.description: Constructs the attribute filter.

list.title: AttributeFilter#accepts
list.description: A specialization of CityObjectFilter to filter the city objects from their attributes. The attributes tested are tileId, batchId and the props. By default, this filter accepts all city objects.

list.title: AttributeFilter#toString
list.description: A specialization of CityObjectFilter to filter the city objects from their attributes. The attributes tested are tileId, batchId and the props. By default, this filter accepts all city objects.

list.title: AttributeFilterSelector
list.description: Constructs the attribute filter selector from the provider.

list.title: AttributeFilterSelector#onSubmit
list.description: A filter selector for the AttributeFilter filter. It allows the user to select it in the filter window, and specify some parameters (such as the tile ID and the batch ID). It also serves as an example of implementation for the FilterSelector class.

list.description: Audio component controller

list.title: CityObject
list.description: Constructs a city object from the given parameters.

list.title: CityObjectFilter
list.description: Constructs a new city object filter, from an acceptation function. If no acceptation function was provided, the filter accepts all city objects.

list.title: CityObjectFilter#accepts
list.description: Represents a filter for city objects. It is basically a function that takes a city object and returns wether it is acceptable.

list.title: CityObjectFilter#toString
list.description: Represents a filter for city objects. It is basically a function that takes a city object and returns wether it is acceptable.

list.title: CityObjectID#equal
list.description:
Represents an identifier for one or more city objects. This class can be used to represent :

  • a set of city objects in a same tile.

list.description:
Represents an identifier for one or more city objects. This class can be used to represent :

  • a single city object.
  • a set of city objects in a same tile.

list.title: DocumentProvider#addFilter
list.description: Represents the set of documents that is displayed in the view. This includes the list of filtered documents, as well as the currently displayed one. It uses a DocumentService to retrieve documents from the server. It also emits events when the filtered documents, or the currently displayed document change.

It uses a DocumentService to retrieve documents from the server. It also emits events when the filtered documents, or the currently displayed document change.

list.title: GuidedTourController
list.description: Constructor for GuidedTourController The controller reads data from a database to build one or more guided tours Each guided tour is a succession of "steps" Each step has a document + tour text + doc text (steps are instances of the TourStep class) Multiple guided tours are supported (only one tour is finished for the demo) For the demo : options.preventUserFromChangingTour allows to hide the buttons for changing tour

list.title: GuidedTourController#getCurrentStep
list.description: Class: GuidedTourController Description : The GuidedTourController is an object handling the view, interracting with the server to get information and data (guided tours) It handles the display of guided tours in the guided tour window, and all the functionalities related to the guided tour (start, exit, next, previous...) GuidedTours are made of steps with properties : index, document, text1 and text2.

list.title: GuidedTourController#getCurrentTour
list.description: Class: GuidedTourController Description : The GuidedTourController is an object handling the view, interracting with the server to get information and data (guided tours) It handles the display of guided tours in the guided tour window, and all the functionalities related to the guided tour (start, exit, next, previous...) GuidedTours are made of steps with properties : index, document, text1 and text2.

list.description: Check if an html element belong to another one recursively

list.title: colorBuilding
list.description: Sets the color of one building in the scene.

list.title: createCityObjectID
list.description: Creates a CityObjectID from an anonymous object.

list.title: createTileGroups
list.description: Creates tile groups and associate them with the given materials.

list.title: createTileGroupsFromBatchIDs
list.description: Create groups in the tile mesh from the given batch IDs and materials.

list.title: DEFAULT_MATERIAL
list.description: Default material used by native objects

list.title: defaultConfigScene
list.description: Default scene 3D config

list.title: defaultVariables
list.description: default variables

list.title: getBatchIdFromIntersection
list.description: Gets an object batch ID from an intersection. This methods takes one of the 3 points of the intersection triangle and retrieves the corresponding batch ID in the intersection tile.

list.title: getBatchTableFromTile
list.description: Search a batch table in a tile. A tile is a THREE.js 3DObject with a 3-level hierarchy : Object3D > Scene > Mesh. This function searches into the for the batch table (which is located in the Object3D level).

list.title: getBuildingIdFromIntersection
list.description: Gets a building ID from an intersection. The intersecting object must be a "Mesh" object with a batch id.

list.title: getFirstTileIntersection
list.description: Get the first intersection object where the target is a 3D object with a batch id (a.k.a. the "Mesh" of a tile).

list.title: getMeshesFromTile
list.description: Returns all the THREE.js meshes in the tile

list.title: getTileFromMesh
list.description: Returns the tile in which a mesh is contained

list.title: getTileInLayer
list.description: Find the tile in the 3DTiles layer with the specifid ID.

list.title: getTileInTileset
list.description: Finds the tile in the tileset with the specific ID.

list.title: getTilesInfo
list.description: Creates a Tiles Info (TI) object from a 3DTiles Layer. The TI is an object containing associations between tile, batch IDs and data specific to the batched geometry (vertex indexes, centroid, properties from the batch table).

list.title: getVerticesCentroid
list.description: Computes and returns the centroid of the vertices given as parameter.

list.title: getVisibleTileCount
list.description: Counts the number of 3DTiles tiles displayed by the view.

list.title: getVisibleTiles
list.description: Retrieve all visible 3DTiles visible tiles (ie. those that are currently rendered in the scene). This function recursively explores the tileset to find all tiles and return them in a flattened array.

list.title: MOUSE_STATE_EVENTS
list.description: List of mouse event handle by MouseState

list.title: removeTileVerticesColor
list.description: Removes vertex-specific colors of the tile and switch back to the material's color.

list.title: RenderDataConfig
list.description: Contains path, anchor, scale and rotation.

list.title: RequestService
list.description: Used by Widget.WebService Service used to make authentificate HTTP requests (with a token) Wiki : https://github.com/MEPP-team/UD-Viz/wiki/Request-Service#request-service

list.title: setTileVerticesColor
list.description: Changes the color of a tile, or specific vertices of the tile, using the BufferGeometry.

list.title: setup3DTilesLayer
list.description: It creates a 3D Tiles layer, and adds it to the layer manager

list.title: SoundsConfig
list.description: Contains path

list.title: TemporalOptions
list.description: options for initializing the temporal module.

list.title: tokenizeURI
list.description: Tokenize a URI into a namespace and id

list.title: updateITownsView
list.description: Tells the iTowns view to update the scene. If you made changes to some colors for example, you need to call this function to actually see the changes.

list.title: windows
list.description: List of all registered windows.
